record.title: EXTENSION OF MORNING BUSINESS
record.narrative:
EXTENSION OF MORNING BUSINESS -- (Senate - January 29, 2008)

[Page: S430]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that morning business be extended for 90 minutes, with the time equally divided.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: I note the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, is it in order for me to make a comment as in morning business at this time?

record.chair: The Senate is in a period of morning business.
record.narrative: (The remarks of Mr. STEVENS pertaining to the submission of S. Res. 433 are printed in today's Record under "Submitted Resolutions.")

speaking.paragraph: I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The bill clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
